title: Need advice on unpacking cmake project thats' in a tar.gz that's inside a .zip.
body:
I suspect that this has been solved before but I haven't found any direct hits.

I'm putting together a package for [bcl2fastq2](https://support.illumina.com/downloads/bcl2fastq-conversion-software-v2-18.html).

The [source link](https://support.illumina.com/content/dam/illumina-support/documents/downloads/software/bcl2fastq/bcl2fastq2-v2-18-0-12-tar.zip) points to a zip file that Spack unpacks for me into:

```
var/spack/stage/bcl2fastq2-2fastq2-v2-18-0-12-t3cez4v7rtnp3hidzsyf5eaaq73dla5m/spack-expanded-archive
```

That directory contains a gzipped tarball:

```
var/spack/stage/bcl2fastq2-2fastq2-v2-18-0-12-t3cez4v7rtnp3hidzsyf5eaaq73dla5m/spack-expanded-archive/bcl2fastq2-v2.18.0.12.tar.gz
```

I need to unpack that tarball, it contains a `src` dir.  Illumina's build instructions say that I should `cd` into that directory and run configure.  I'm planning to let/help `CMakePackage` handle that final step.

The install method of the turbomole package [does a little dance in the install method](https://github.com/LLNL/spack/blob/develop/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/turbomole/package.py#L82) untar-ing something and then doing everything inside a `with working_dir(...`.

Are there any other existing examples of packages for which the source is doubly archived?

Would it be cleaner to extend/override `fetch` or ....

Thanks in advance!
